title: Indian Number System
description: Identify place values and read or write numbers in the Indian system.

questions.question: What is the place value of 4 in 3,42,567?
questions.explanation: In 3,42,567, the digit 4 is in the ten-thousands place.

questions.question: How is 7,08,205 written in words (Indian system)?
options: Seven lakh eight thousand two hundred five
Seventy lakh eight thousand two hundred five
Seven million eight thousand two hundred five
questions.explanation: Correct reading is: Seven lakh eight thousand two hundred five.

questions.question: How many zeros are there in one crore?
questions.explanation: One crore = 10,000,000, which has seven zeros.

questions.question: Write the numeral for “Nine lakh three thousand forty.”
Which period contains the hundreds, tens, and ones places in the Indian system?
questions.explanation: The units (ones) period is made up of hundreds, tens, and ones.

questions.question: In 56,37,921 which digit is in the lakhs place?
questions.explanation: 6 is in the lakhs place, while 5 is in the ten-lakhs place.

questions.question: What is the value of 2 in 7,24,105?
questions.explanation: The digit 2 is in the ten-thousands place → 2 × 10,000 = 20,000.

questions.question: What is the predecessor of one lakh?
How many digits are there in ten lakh (10,00,000)?
questions.explanation: Ten lakh is 1,000,000, which is a 7-digit number.

questions.question: Which digit is in the ten-thousands place of 4,67,891?
